alert.note: Alert for Cass; Henry; Johnson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 3:59AM CST until January 28 at 6:40AM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Creek at Blairstown affecting Johnson MO, Cass and Henry Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Big Creek...including Blairstown...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek at Blairstown. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The west bank of the creek begins to flood. At 23.0 feet, Flooding occurs at the west approach to the N Highway bridge located 0.2 miles west of Blairstown. Flooding also occurs across B Highway near Big Creek which is several miles northwest of Blairstown. At 26.0 feet, Many farm levees along Big Creek are overtopped. Flooding of rural areas behind the levees occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Fri Sat 6am 6pm 6am Big Creek Blairstown 20.0 24.0 Fri 3am 24.2 22.0 20.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.
